CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel series of low band gap donor - acceptor copolymers derived from 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) and 5,6-difluoro-4,7-bis(4-alkylthien-2-yl)benzo [c][1,2,5]thiadiazole bearing various alkyl side chains , such as PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , and 16 ) , were developed for high - performance bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ). PffBB-n exhibited not only strong and wide absorption but also controllable aggregation behavior in solution and thin films , in which aggregation behavior was greatly influenced by the length of alkyl side chains attached , temperature applied , and solvent used. Aggregation - induced spectral broadening further extended the absorption cutoff to ∼ 780 nm in thin films , leading to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.6 eV. Because of the strong aggregation strength , PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains shows enhanced ordered molecular packing and good crystallinity as revealed by X-ray diffraction studies. In addition , temperature - dependent aggregation of the PffBB-n:PC71BM blend was investigated and optimized in the PSC fabrication. PSCs fabricated with the PffBB-n:PC71BM blend , conducted at 80 °C optimized coating temperature , showed relatively high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) ranging from 8.22 to 9.93% . The well - ordered BHJ film morphology of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend led to superior balanced charge carrier mobility , good exciton dissociation , and the least recombination loss and hence PffBB-14 - based PSC reached the highest photovoltaic performance with a PCE of 9.93% , a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and , a FF of 64.36% . Our results demonstrated that the synergetic effect of alkyl side chain modification and processing temperature modulation to control aggregation provides practical and powerful tools to optimize the absorption broadening and optoelectronic properties of an active layer in a BHJ PSC , thus enhancing its ultimate performance . Polymeric materials show promising potential for the applications of future solar cell technology because of their advantages of solution processability , lightweight , cost efficiency , and mechanical flexibility. 1 Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) with power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) exceeding 10% have been realized during the last decade , which was benefited from tremendous efforts on the development of advanced donor and / or acceptor materials , device engineering and optimized fabrication processes. 2-12 Nevertheless , the poor sunlight harvesting efficiency and low charge carrier mobility of organic semiconducting materials still hinder the further efficiency improvement of PSCs. Polythiophene ( PT ) materials have been proved to be promising donor materials as most PT materials exhibit high regioregularity for easy formation of well - organized active layer morphology , thus providing an auspicious way to develop new and efficient photovoltaic ( PV ) materials. 13-20 However , thiophene - based units are strongly electron - rich in nature , which often give rise to a high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. BDT: 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b′]dithiophene
2. PffBB-n: a series of copolymers derived from BDT and 5,6-difluoro-4,7-bis(4-alkylthien-2-yl)benzo [c][1,2,5]thiadiazole
3. PC71BM: a donor material used in the blend with PffBB-n
4. PT: polythiophene

These are the entities mentioned in the paragraph that refer to specific materials or classes of materials.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name":

1. BDT
2. PffBB-n
3. PC71BM

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to "Material Name", presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| BDT |
| PffBB-n |
| PC71BM |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Paragraph: A novel series of low band gap donor - acceptor copolymers derived from 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) and 5,6-difluoro-4,7-bis(4-alkylthien-2-yl)benzo [c][1,2,5]thiadiazole bearing various alkyl side chains , such as PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , and 16 ) , were developed for high - performance bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ). PffBB-n exhibited not only strong and wide absorption but also controllable aggregation behavior in solution and thin films , in which aggregation behavior was greatly influenced by the length of alkyl side chains attached , temperature applied , and solvent used. Aggregation - induced spectral broadening further extended the absorption cutoff to ∼ 780 nm in thin films , leading to a narrow optical band gap of ∼ 1.6 eV. Because of the strong aggregation strength , PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains shows enhanced ordered molecular packing and good crystallinity as revealed by X-ray diffraction studies. In addition , temperature - dependent aggregation of the PffBB-n:PC71BM blend was investigated and optimized in the PSC fabrication. PSCs fabricated with the PffBB-n:PC71BM blend , conducted at 80 °C optimized coating temperature , showed relatively high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) ranging from 8.22 to 9.93% . The well - ordered BHJ film morphology of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend led to superior balanced charge carrier mobility , good exciton dissociation , and the least recombination loss and hence PffBB-14 - based PSC reached the highest photovoltaic performance with a PCE of 9.93% , a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and , a FF of 64.36% . Polythiophene ( PT ) materials have been proved to be promising donor materials as most PT materials exhibit high regioregularity for easy formation of well - organized active layer morphology , thus providing an auspicious way to develop new and efficient photovoltaic ( PV ) materials. 13-20 However , thiophene - based units are strongly electron - rich in nature , which often give rise to a high - lying highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level.

Sure! Let's identify the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b′]dithiophene (BDT)
2. 5,6-difluoro-4,7-bis(4-alkylthien-2-yl)benzo [c][1,2,5]thiadiazole
3. PffBB-n (n = 10, 12, 14, and 16)
4. PC71BM
5. Polymer solar cells (PSCs)
6. Power conversion efficiency (PCE)
7. Open-circuit voltage (V oc)
8. Short-circuit current density (J sc)
9. Fill factor (FF)
10. Regioregularity
11. Highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy level

Note that some of these terms are used as proper nouns (e.g., BDT, PffBB-n, PC71BM), while others are general terms used to describe properties of materials (e.g., power conversion efficiency, open-circuit voltage, short-circuit current density, fill factor, regioregularity, highest occupied molecular orbital energy level).

Of course! Here are the relevant entities from the text that refer to property names of materials:

2. PC71BM (PC71BM is a typical donor material)

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A novel series of low band gap donor - acceptor copolymers derived from 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b′]dithiophene ( BDT ) and 5,6-difluoro-4,7-bis(4-alkylthien-2-yl)benzo [c][1,2,5]thiadiazole bearing various alkyl side chains , such as PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , and 16 ) , were developed for high - performance bulk - heterojunction ( BHJ ) polymer solar cells ( PSCs ). Because of the strong aggregation strength , PffBB-n equipped with long alkyl side chains shows enhanced ordered molecular packing and good crystallinity as revealed by X-ray diffraction studies. In addition , temperature - dependent aggregation of the PffBB-n:PC71BM blend was investigated and optimized in the PSC fabrication. PSCs fabricated with the PffBB-n:PC71BM blend , conducted at 80 °C optimized coating temperature , showed relatively high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) ranging from 8.22 to 9.93% . The well - ordered BHJ film morphology of the PffBB-14:PC71BM blend led to superior balanced charge carrier mobility , good exciton dissociation , and the least recombination loss and hence PffBB-14 - based PSC reached the highest photovoltaic performance with a PCE of 9.93% , a V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and , a FF of 64.36% . Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the values of material properties in the paragraph:

1. Values of the materials used in the study:
 * BDT: 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-benzo[2,1-b:3,4-b′]dithiophene (number: 45, unit: mol)
 * PffBB-n (n = 10, 12, 14, 16): novel series of low band gap donor - acceptor copolymers derived from BDT and 5,6-difluoro-4,7-bis(4-alkylthien-2-yl)benzo [c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (numbers: 10, 12, 14, 16, unit: mol)
 * PC71BM: poly[N,N-di(1-phenyl-1-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester)] (number: 71, unit: mol)
2. Values of the properties of the materials:
 * Absorption cutoff: 780 nm (unit: nm)
 * Optical band gap: 1.6 eV (unit: eV)
 * Aggregation behavior: influenced by the length of alkyl side chains attached, temperature applied, and solvent used (no specific values given)
 * Temperature - dependent aggregation: investigated and optimized in the PSC fabrication (no specific values given)
 * Power conversion efficiency (PCE): ranging from 8.22 to 9.93% (unit: percentage)
 * Open circuit voltage (V oc): 0.92 V (unit: voltage)
 * Short-circuit current density (J sc): 16.77 mA cm^-2 (unit: current density)
 * FF: 64.36% (unit: percentage)
3. Values of the parameters used in the study:
 * Solvent used: no specific solvent is mentioned in the passage
 * Coating temperature: optimized coating temperature of 80 °C (unit: temperature)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given passage:

1. "power conversion efficiency (PCE)" - This refers to the value of the material property of efficiency in converting sunlight into electrical energy.
2. "open circuit voltage (Voc)" - This refers to the value of the material property of voltage in the open circuit configuration.
3. "short-circuit current density (Jsc)" - This refers to the value of the material property of current density in the short-circuit configuration.
4. "fill factor (FF)" - This refers to the value of the material property of fill factor, which is a measure of the efficiency of the solar cell in absorbing and utilizing light.

The other entities mentioned in the passage, such as "BDT", "PffBB-n", and "PC71BM", are not directly related to the value of material properties.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
